Package com.oracle.tools.deferred

Interface Summary
Deferred<T> A Deferred object represents a reference some well-known object, that of which may yet not be available.
 

Class Summary
Cached<T> A Cached object is a specialized Deferred that holds a reference to (ie: caches) an object that was successfully returned by another Deferred.
DeferredHelper The DeferredHelper defines a collection of static helper methods for working with Deferreds.
DeferredInvoke<T> A DeferredInvoke is a Deferred that represents a request to invoke a non-void, typically non-static method on a Deferred.
Ensured<T> An Ensured is a specialized Deferred implementation that does it's best to guarantee a non-null reference will be returned when a call to Ensured.get() is made.
Existing<T> A Existing is a specialized Deferred implementation that is based on a well-known and already established object, that is guaranteed to be available when Existing.get() is called.
Future<T> A Future is a Deferred representation of a standard Java Future.
NeverAvailable<T> A NeverAvailable is a specialized Deferred that always throws an ObjectNotAvailableException when attempting to call NeverAvailable.get().
NotAvailable<T> A NotAvailable is a specialized Deferred that always returns null when attempting to call NotAvailable.get().
Notified<T> A Notified is a Deferred that represents a synchronized object that should be Object.notify()ed, including with Object.notifyAll(), before it can be used.
Supervised<T> A Supervised is a Deferred adapter that has knowledge of the last known availability of an object, the purpose of which is to ensure that the underlying object is protected from repeated and perhaps continuously unrelenting requests by an application to access it, when it simply may be unavailable for a long period of time.
 

Exception Summary
ObjectNotAvailableException A ObjectNotAvailableException is thrown by a Deferred when an attempt to acquire an underlying object fails due to it not being available and for intensive purposes, will never become available, regardless of the number of retries.
